txt.en: 'Thorin sleeps deep, with his Arkenstone and his shield.'
'For so long we looked only inwards. Now, suddenly, dwarves speak of the hills to the east and of the ancient mountains to the north.'
'The mountain's roots run deep, as do those of Durin's Folk.'
'Best keep busy. Idle dwarves get to dreaming of distant and long-lost delves.'
'Proud as I am of my craft, I cannot match my grandsire's!'
'It is good the war is ended! Erebor shall not be taken from us again!'
'Enough with war! Now is the time for delving, craft, and trade!'
'It was in the Grey Mountains in the north, it is said, that Durin first awoke.'
'What word have you heard from from the Iron Hills? I have heard none and worry.'
'If half the rumours they tell of JÃ¡rnfast are true... then the other half must bald-faced lies!'
